abstract: Dai-ichi Mutual Life Insurance, Japan’s second-largest life insurer, said it would sell about $11.7 billion of shares in the country’s largest initial public offering in more than a decade.
snippet: Dai-ichi Mutual Life Insurance, Japan’s second-largest life insurer, said it would sell about $11.7 billion of shares in the country’s largest initial public offering in more than a decade.
lead_paragraph: Dai-ichi Mutual Life Insurance, Japan’s second-largest life insurer, said it would sell about 1.07 trillion yen ($11.7 billion) of shares in the country’s largest initial public offering in more than a decade, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Dai-ichi Mutual Life Plans $11.7 Billion I.P.O.
